text: 3. Acurve R = a(t) is reparametrized in terms of arclength as R = b(s) = a(t(s)). Of the following options, which best describes the relationship between the vectors a’(to) and b’(s¢), where t(s¢) = t¢? You may assume a’(t) and b’(s) exist and are nonzero for all ¢, s > 0. A. they are parallel and point in the same direction B. they are parallel and point in opposite directions C. they are perpendicular D. they have the same magnitude E. they are equal
